title.text: Multi-Word Expressions as Discourse Relation Markers (DRMs)

abstractContent.text: 1 Invited Talk Abstract Usually, by Multi-Word Expressions (MWEs) we mean expressions whose structure and meaning cannot be derived from their component words as they occur independently.
In this talk I will discuss a different kind of multi-word expressions that behave as discourse relation markers (DRMs), yet do not seem to belong to well-defined syntactic classes.
The apparent open-endedness of these expressions is a challenge for their automatic identification.
